Hi Hagop,

 

Aster has not agree to accept the below cause for opening a concession in Tryano

 

“The policies under 10.1(iii) shall include a standard form of cross liability clause to effect that the insurance coverage shall apply to Allied and the Company as if a separate policy had been issued to each Party.”

 

They have agree to take a cover for Tryano as per the attached. Please advise whether the attached are sufficient for us to waive the above clause from the insurance?

 

Kind regards,

OMAIR SHAFIQ​​​​

Subject: Re: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft
Importance: High

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well, attached the draft contract with Aster comments. Below the points they mentioned in their email as well with our answer in blue

 

1.	Commission @ 32% of Gross Sales + 2% Marketing No other charges (utilities, e-commerce etc.) this need to be update accordingly in the agreement - AGREED lets remove any mention of other fees (utility and e-commerce) since it's included in the 32% margin of Net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
2.	All amounts to be on NET SALES – currently the agreement states on Gross sales, industry standard is to pay after customer discount (on what the customer pays) this is the same as we have with Galleries Lafayette. AGREED lets pass mentioned gross sales to net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
3.

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CATHB1K - aster optical - concession contract draft\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
AGREED lets pass mentioned gross sales to net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
3.	Re Article 10 Insurance, we accept clause 10.1 (iii), however clause 10.3 is not accepted and would request to remove, as both parties would have liability insurance. Please clarify the meaning/implication @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com> 

 

4.	Fitout date needs to be amended, currently states 28th Dec, which would mean we will become liable to delay charges. Aster to confirmed agreeing on date but. Actual fit-out to be done and completed by 3rd February 2025, meeting and workstream related to the fit out (as per appendix B ) to be initiated before as per the date agreed in the appendix.

 

 

We'd really appreciates it if you could prioritize this case and get back to us by Monday, 13th January 2025. We’re aiming to open the concession (Phase 1) by 17th January, so a quick reply would help us update Aster in time.

 

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Re: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

This is to inform you that we are planning to terminate our current partnership with Al Jaber in Tryano on the 27th December and Aster will be the one replacing them, ideally starting 28 december.

 

For the transition we want to avoid having business interruptions. To do so, I kindly ask you if you could share with us the clean draft by tomorrow the latest so that we can send it to Aster for review.

 

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

Hi Dana,

metadata.doc_id: CATHB1K - aster optical - concession contract draft\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CATHB1K - aster optical - concession contract draft\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
Hi Dana,

 

Apologize if I was not clear. Currently Al Jaber is selling sunglasses in Tryano under concession agreement. Since the contract is finished and was not renewed we are willing to end this partnership (thread attached). Aster Optical will be the new distributor under concession agreement as per the terms mentioned in my previous email. Below more details to your questions.

*	Distributor will take over a designated area of 35 sqm in the store - Layout plan will be shared soon and to be added in anex,
*	Design and fit out to be handled by Aster optical after having mutually agreed on Design + Cost since Capex will be shared (50/50)
*	Headcount: Aster Optical need to make sure to have 1 sale associate on the designated area at all times,
*	Payment of the product shall be accepted by all modes of payment applied in store,
*	Alliged tryano shopping bags have to be used,
*	Allied to collect all cash and credit card payments and shall issue to the company a monthly statement within 10 days of the end of the relevant calendar month detailing gross sales, amount of the percentage comission on sales, remittance of sales collected.
*	Amount collected shall be paid 15 days after the end of the calendar month after deducting the commision on sales (32% comission) + the marketing contribution (2% comission on sales for marketing).

Because we will need to work on a new design / concept of the area (new furniture needed etc) and we wish to reduce to the maximum disruption of sales, we will operate in two phases:

*	Phase 1:

	*	Soft launch - Supplier to send stock and use the area for sale using our current furniture (ETA: Mid december)
	*	Supplier to start working on the design and fit out then seek approval from Allied,

Soft launch - Supplier to send stock and use the area for sale using our current furniture (ETA: Mid december)
	*	Supplier to start working on the design and fit out then seek approval from Allied,

*	 
*	Phase 2: Design and Fit out to be executed by the supplier - fit out to be finished mid January.

Let me know if you need further details,

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

From: Tom Jamet <Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com <mailto:Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Monday, November 11, 2024 5:36 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Reda Keddaji <Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com <mailto:Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

We’d need your help to draft a concession contract for Aster Optical, who’ll be taking over management of our Sunglasses department in Tryano. Here are the terms we’ve agreed on:

*	Duration: 2 years - Starting date 16/12/2024
*	32% margin
*	2% marketing
*	1 headcount
*	Capex 50/50

Location would be in our current sunglasses zone (currently under management from another supplier but contract is finished). I will share with you the exact layout as soon as I receive the updated one.

 

Please let me know if you need more information,

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

From: Tom Jamet <Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com <mailto:Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Monday, November 11, 2024 8:29 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Reda Keddaji <Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com <mailto:Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hi Dana,

 

Apologize if I was not clear. Currently Al Jaber is selling sunglasses in Tryano under concession agreement. Since the contract is finished and was not renewed we are willing to end this partnership (thread attached). Aster Optical will be the new distributor under concession agreement as per the terms mentioned in my previous email. Below more details to your questions.

*	Distributor will take over a designated area of 35 sqm in the store - Layout plan will be shared soon and to be added in anex,
*	Design and fit out to be handled by Aster optical after having mutually agreed on Design + Cost since Capex will be shared (50/50)
*	Headcount: Aster Optical need to make sure to have 1 sale associate on the designated area at all times,
*	Payment of the product shall be accepted by all modes of payment applied in store,
*	Alliged tryano shopping bags have to be used,
*	Allied to collect all cash and credit card payments and shall issue to the company a monthly statement within 10 days of the end of the relevant calendar month detailing gross sales, amount of the percentage comission on sales, remittance of sales collected.

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CATHB1K - aster optical - concession contract draft\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
ll issue to the company a monthly statement within 10 days of the end of the relevant calendar month detailing gross sales, amount of the percentage comission on sales, remittance of sales collected.
*	Amount collected shall be paid 15 days after the end of the calendar month after deducting the commision on sales (32% comission) + the marketing contribution (2% comission on sales for marketing).

Because we will need to work on a new design / concept of the area (new furniture needed etc) and we wish to reduce to the maximum disruption of sales, we will operate in two phases:

*	Phase 1:

	*	Soft launch - Supplier to send stock and use the area for sale using our current furniture (ETA: Mid december)
	*	Supplier to start working on the design and fit out then seek approval from Allied,

*	 
*	Phase 2: Design and Fit out to be executed by the supplier - fit out to be finished mid January.

Let me know if you need further details,

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

We’d need your help to draft a concession contract for Aster Optical, who’ll be taking over management of our Sunglasses department in Tryano. Here are the terms we’ve agreed on:

*	Duration: 2 years - Starting date 16/12/2024
*	32% margin
*	2% marketing
*	1 headcount
*	Capex 50/50

Location would be in our current sunglasses zone (currently under management from another supplier but contract is finished). I will share with you the exact layout as soon as I receive the updated one.

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well, attached the draft contract with Aster comments. Below the points they mentioned in their email as well with our answer in blue

 

1.	Commission @ 32% of Gross Sales + 2% Marketing No other charges (utilities, e-commerce etc.) this need to be update accordingly in the agreement - AGREED lets remove any mention of other fees (utility and e-commerce) since it's included in the 32% margin of Net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
2.

reement - AGREED lets remove any mention of other fees (utility and e-commerce) since it's included in the 32% margin of Net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
2.	All amounts to be on NET SALES – currently the agreement states on Gross sales, industry standard is to pay after customer discount (on what the customer pays) this is the same as we have with Galleries Lafayette. AGREED lets pass mentioned gross sales to net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
3.	Re Article 10 Insurance, we accept clause 10.1 (iii), however clause 10.3 is not accepted and would request to remove, as both parties would have liability insurance. Please clarify the meaning/implication @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com> 

 

4.	Fitout date needs to be amended, currently states 28th Dec, which would mean we will become liable to delay charges. Aster to confirmed agreeing on date but. Actual fit-out to be done and completed by 3rd February 2025, meeting and workstream related to the fit out (as per appendix B ) to be initiated before as per the date agreed in the appendix.

 

 

We'd really appreciates it if you could prioritize this case and get back to us by Monday, 13th January 2025. We’re aiming to open the concession (Phase 1) by 17th January, so a quick reply would help us update Aster in time.

 

Best,

From: Tom Jamet <Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com <mailto:Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Tuesday, December 17, 2024 1:36 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >

Subject: Re: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

This is to inform you that we are planning to terminate our current partnership with Al Jaber in Tryano on the 27th December and Aster will be the one replacing them, ideally starting 28 december.

 

For the transition we want to avoid having business interruptions. To do so, I kindly ask you if you could share with us the clean draft by tomorrow the latest so that we can send it to Aster for review.

 

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R.

Hi Dana,

 

Apologize if I was not clear. Currently Al Jaber is selling sunglasses in Tryano under concession agreement. Since the contract is finished and was not renewed we are willing to end this partnership (thread attached). Aster Optical will be the new distributor under concession agreement as per the terms mentioned in my previous email. Below more details to your questions.

*	Distributor will take over a designated area of 35 sqm in the store - Layout plan will be shared soon and to be added in anex,
*	Design and fit out to be handled by Aster optical after having mutually agreed on Design + Cost since Capex will be shared (50/50)
*	Headcount: Aster Optical need to make sure to have 1 sale associate on the designated area at all times,
*	Payment of the product shall be accepted by all modes of payment applied in store,
*	Alliged tryano shopping bags have to be used,
*	Allied to collect all cash and credit card payments and shall issue to the company a monthly statement within 10 days of the end of the relevant calendar month detailing gross sales, amount of the percentage comission on sales, remittance of sales collected.
*	Amount collected shall be paid 15 days after the end of the calendar month after deducting the commision on sales (32% comission) + the marketing contribution (2% comission on sales for marketing).

chunks.text:
Amount collected shall be paid 15 days after the end of the calendar month after deducting the commision on sales (32% comission) + the marketing contribution (2% comission on sales for marketing).

Because we will need to work on a new design / concept of the area (new furniture needed etc) and we wish to reduce to the maximum disruption of sales, we will operate in two phases:

*	Phase 1:

	*	Soft launch - Supplier to send stock and use the area for sale using our current furniture (ETA: Mid december)
	*	Supplier to start working on the design and fit out then seek approval from Allied,

*	 
*	Phase 2: Design and Fit out to be executed by the supplier - fit out to be finished mid January.

Let me know if you need further details,

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

We’d need your help to draft a concession contract for Aster Optical, who’ll be taking over management of our Sunglasses department in Tryano. Here are the terms we’ve agreed on:

*	Duration: 2 years - Starting date 16/12/2024
*	32% margin
*	2% marketing
*	1 headcount
*	Capex 50/50

Location would be in our current sunglasses zone (currently under management from another supplier but contract is finished). I will share with you the exact layout as soon as I receive the updated one.

From: Tom Jamet <Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com <mailto:Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Monday, November 11, 2024 8:29 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Reda Keddaji <Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com <mailto:Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hi Dana,

 

Apologize if I was not clear. Currently Al Jaber is selling sunglasses in Tryano under concession agreement. Since the contract is finished and was not renewed we are willing to end this partnership (thread attached). Aster Optical will be the new distributor under concession agreement as per the terms mentioned in my previous email. Below more details to your questions.

*	Distributor will take over a designated area of 35 sqm in the store - Layout plan will be shared soon and to be added in anex,
*	Design and fit out to be handled by Aster optical after having mutually agreed on Design + Cost since Capex will be shared (50/50)
*	Headcount: Aster Optical need to make sure to have 1 sale associate on the designated area at all times,
*	Payment of the product shall be accepted by all modes of payment applied in store,
*	Alliged tryano shopping bags have to be used,
*	Allied to collect all cash and credit card payments and shall issue to the company a monthly statement within 10 days of the end of the relevant calendar month detailing gross sales, amount of the percentage comission on sales, remittance of sales collected.

chunks.text:
ll issue to the company a monthly statement within 10 days of the end of the relevant calendar month detailing gross sales, amount of the percentage comission on sales, remittance of sales collected.
*	Amount collected shall be paid 15 days after the end of the calendar month after deducting the commision on sales (32% comission) + the marketing contribution (2% comission on sales for marketing).

Because we will need to work on a new design / concept of the area (new furniture needed etc) and we wish to reduce to the maximum disruption of sales, we will operate in two phases:

*	Phase 1:

	*	Soft launch - Supplier to send stock and use the area for sale using our current furniture (ETA: Mid december)
	*	Supplier to start working on the design and fit out then seek approval from Allied,

*	 
*	Phase 2: Design and Fit out to be executed by the supplier - fit out to be finished mid January.

Let me know if you need further details,

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

Subject: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

We’d need your help to draft a concession contract for Aster Optical, who’ll be taking over management of our Sunglasses department in Tryano. Here are the terms we’ve agreed on:

*	Duration: 2 years - Starting date 16/12/2024
*	32% margin
*	2% marketing
*	1 headcount
*	Capex 50/50

Location would be in our current sunglasses zone (currently under management from another supplier but contract is finished). I will share with you the exact layout as soon as I receive the updated one.

Dear Omair,

 

The cross-liability clause is related only to the Liability Insurance policy which is already present in the attached.

 



 

“The policies under 10.1(iii) shall include a standard form of cross liability clause to effect that the insurance coverage shall apply to Allied and the Company as if a separate policy had been issued to each Party.”

 

As long as the clause reads “Cross Liability clause in favour of [Mall] / Landlord”, this article is satisfied.

 

As such, there is no reason Aster Optical should object to it as they are already in compliance if the same template will be used.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >; Omair Shafiq <Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Reda Keddaji <Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com <mailto:Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com> >; Firas Karbala <Firas.Karbala@chalhoub.com <mailto:Firas.Karbala@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft
Importance: High

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well, attached the draft contract with Aster comments. Below the points they mentioned in their email as well with our answer in blue

 

1.	Commission @ 32% of Gross Sales + 2% Marketing No other charges (utilities, e-commerce etc.) this need to be update accordingly in the agreement - AGREED lets remove any mention of other fees (utility and e-commerce) since it's included in the 32% margin of Net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
2.	All amounts to be on NET SALES – currently the agreement states on Gross sales, industry standard is to pay after customer discount (on what the customer pays) this is the same as we have with Galleries Lafayette. AGREED lets pass mentioned gross sales to net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
3.

metadata.doc_id: CATHB1K - aster optical - concession contract draft\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CATHB1K - aster optical - concession contract draft\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
AGREED lets pass mentioned gross sales to net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
3.	Re Article 10 Insurance, we accept clause 10.1 (iii), however clause 10.3 is not accepted and would request to remove, as both parties would have liability insurance. Please clarify the meaning/implication @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com> 

 

4.	Fitout date needs to be amended, currently states 28th Dec, which would mean we will become liable to delay charges. Aster to confirmed agreeing on date but. Actual fit-out to be done and completed by 3rd February 2025, meeting and workstream related to the fit out (as per appendix B ) to be initiated before as per the date agreed in the appendix.

 

 

We'd really appreciates it if you could prioritize this case and get back to us by Monday, 13th January 2025. We’re aiming to open the concession (Phase 1) by 17th January, so a quick reply would help us update Aster in time.

 

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Re: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

This is to inform you that we are planning to terminate our current partnership with Al Jaber in Tryano on the 27th December and Aster will be the one replacing them, ideally starting 28 december.

 

For the transition we want to avoid having business interruptions. To do so, I kindly ask you if you could share with us the clean draft by tomorrow the latest so that we can send it to Aster for review.

 

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

Hi Dana,

metadata.doc_id: CATHB1K - aster optical - concession contract draft\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CATHB1K - aster optical - concession contract draft\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
Hi Dana,

 

Apologize if I was not clear. Currently Al Jaber is selling sunglasses in Tryano under concession agreement. Since the contract is finished and was not renewed we are willing to end this partnership (thread attached). Aster Optical will be the new distributor under concession agreement as per the terms mentioned in my previous email. Below more details to your questions.

*	Distributor will take over a designated area of 35 sqm in the store - Layout plan will be shared soon and to be added in anex,
*	Design and fit out to be handled by Aster optical after having mutually agreed on Design + Cost since Capex will be shared (50/50)
*	Headcount: Aster Optical need to make sure to have 1 sale associate on the designated area at all times,
*	Payment of the product shall be accepted by all modes of payment applied in store,
*	Alliged tryano shopping bags have to be used,
*	Allied to collect all cash and credit card payments and shall issue to the company a monthly statement within 10 days of the end of the relevant calendar month detailing gross sales, amount of the percentage comission on sales, remittance of sales collected.
*	Amount collected shall be paid 15 days after the end of the calendar month after deducting the commision on sales (32% comission) + the marketing contribution (2% comission on sales for marketing).

Because we will need to work on a new design / concept of the area (new furniture needed etc) and we wish to reduce to the maximum disruption of sales, we will operate in two phases:

*	Phase 1:

	*	Soft launch - Supplier to send stock and use the area for sale using our current furniture (ETA: Mid december)
	*	Supplier to start working on the design and fit out then seek approval from Allied,

Soft launch - Supplier to send stock and use the area for sale using our current furniture (ETA: Mid december)
	*	Supplier to start working on the design and fit out then seek approval from Allied,

*	 
*	Phase 2: Design and Fit out to be executed by the supplier - fit out to be finished mid January.

Let me know if you need further details,

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

From: Tom Jamet <Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com <mailto:Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Monday, November 11, 2024 5:36 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Reda Keddaji <Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com <mailto:Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

We’d need your help to draft a concession contract for Aster Optical, who’ll be taking over management of our Sunglasses department in Tryano. Here are the terms we’ve agreed on:

*	Duration: 2 years - Starting date 16/12/2024
*	32% margin
*	2% marketing
*	1 headcount
*	Capex 50/50

Location would be in our current sunglasses zone (currently under management from another supplier but contract is finished). I will share with you the exact layout as soon as I receive the updated one.

 

Please let me know if you need more information,

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

From: Tom Jamet <Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com <mailto:Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Monday, November 11, 2024 8:29 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Reda Keddaji <Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com <mailto:Reda.Keddaji@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hi Dana,

 

Apologize if I was not clear. Currently Al Jaber is selling sunglasses in Tryano under concession agreement. Since the contract is finished and was not renewed we are willing to end this partnership (thread attached). Aster Optical will be the new distributor under concession agreement as per the terms mentioned in my previous email. Below more details to your questions.

*	Distributor will take over a designated area of 35 sqm in the store - Layout plan will be shared soon and to be added in anex,
*	Design and fit out to be handled by Aster optical after having mutually agreed on Design + Cost since Capex will be shared (50/50)
*	Headcount: Aster Optical need to make sure to have 1 sale associate on the designated area at all times,
*	Payment of the product shall be accepted by all modes of payment applied in store,
*	Alliged tryano shopping bags have to be used,
*	Allied to collect all cash and credit card payments and shall issue to the company a monthly statement within 10 days of the end of the relevant calendar month detailing gross sales, amount of the percentage comission on sales, remittance of sales collected.

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CATHB1K - aster optical - concession contract draft\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
ll issue to the company a monthly statement within 10 days of the end of the relevant calendar month detailing gross sales, amount of the percentage comission on sales, remittance of sales collected.
*	Amount collected shall be paid 15 days after the end of the calendar month after deducting the commision on sales (32% comission) + the marketing contribution (2% comission on sales for marketing).

Because we will need to work on a new design / concept of the area (new furniture needed etc) and we wish to reduce to the maximum disruption of sales, we will operate in two phases:

*	Phase 1:

	*	Soft launch - Supplier to send stock and use the area for sale using our current furniture (ETA: Mid december)
	*	Supplier to start working on the design and fit out then seek approval from Allied,

*	 
*	Phase 2: Design and Fit out to be executed by the supplier - fit out to be finished mid January.

Let me know if you need further details,

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R. FZE

DUBAI

Subject: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

We’d need your help to draft a concession contract for Aster Optical, who’ll be taking over management of our Sunglasses department in Tryano. Here are the terms we’ve agreed on:

*	Duration: 2 years - Starting date 16/12/2024
*	32% margin
*	2% marketing
*	1 headcount
*	Capex 50/50

Location would be in our current sunglasses zone (currently under management from another supplier but contract is finished). I will share with you the exact layout as soon as I receive the updated one.

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well, attached the draft contract with Aster comments. Below the points they mentioned in their email as well with our answer in blue

 

1.	Commission @ 32% of Gross Sales + 2% Marketing No other charges (utilities, e-commerce etc.) this need to be update accordingly in the agreement - AGREED lets remove any mention of other fees (utility and e-commerce) since it's included in the 32% margin of Net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
2.

reement - AGREED lets remove any mention of other fees (utility and e-commerce) since it's included in the 32% margin of Net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
2.	All amounts to be on NET SALES – currently the agreement states on Gross sales, industry standard is to pay after customer discount (on what the customer pays) this is the same as we have with Galleries Lafayette. AGREED lets pass mentioned gross sales to net sales @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com>  for visibility,
3.	Re Article 10 Insurance, we accept clause 10.1 (iii), however clause 10.3 is not accepted and would request to remove, as both parties would have liability insurance. Please clarify the meaning/implication @Omair Shafiq <mailto:Omair.Shafiq@chalhoub.com> 

 

4.	Fitout date needs to be amended, currently states 28th Dec, which would mean we will become liable to delay charges. Aster to confirmed agreeing on date but. Actual fit-out to be done and completed by 3rd February 2025, meeting and workstream related to the fit out (as per appendix B ) to be initiated before as per the date agreed in the appendix.

 

 

We'd really appreciates it if you could prioritize this case and get back to us by Monday, 13th January 2025. We’re aiming to open the concession (Phase 1) by 17th January, so a quick reply would help us update Aster in time.

 

Best,

From: Tom Jamet <Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com <mailto:Tom.Jamet@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Tuesday, December 17, 2024 1:36 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >

Subject: Re: Aster Optical - Concession contract Draft

 

Hello Dana,

 

Hope you are doing well,

 

This is to inform you that we are planning to terminate our current partnership with Al Jaber in Tryano on the 27th December and Aster will be the one replacing them, ideally starting 28 december.

 

For the transition we want to avoid having business interruptions. To do so, I kindly ask you if you could share with us the clean draft by tomorrow the latest so that we can send it to Aster for review.

 

Best,

 

TOM JAMET​​​​

SENIOR BUYER

C.G.R.
